regional, it is our belief that the costs of travel would not be the
inhibiting factor which they would constitute for national meetings.
The NAEB’s contributions would be limited to reimbursing cooperating
institutions for actual expenses, reports and demonstration materials
expenses, and paying for necessary consultants. Estimate: $1,500
per workshop the first year, $1,000 the second year and $500 the third
year for a total of $6,000 the first year, $4,000 the second year and
$2,000 the third year. All income would be used to reduce the actual
grant expenses used for this purpose. A gradual effort, as needed,
would be made to make these increasingly self-supporting, through the
life of the project.
These workshops and Seminars would also be principally, but not ex¬
clusively, for teachers and teacher-trainers. Some of the other empha¬
ses, as now visualised, would be in the fields of graphics and visual
aids; script planning and writing; production; series planning; evalua¬
tion; and new testing procedures to meet the needs of the new media.
Cross-pollenization with communications, techniques, content and
teacher-training procedures would be emphasized.
C. Consultants and other expenses;
